title: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Balanced, 4-Way, Incomplete Block Design to Evaluate the Effects of a Single Administration of SAM-531 on Sleep Electroencephalogram (EEG) and Quantitative Wake EEG (qEEG) in Healthy Subjects
description_brief: Primary: To evaluate the pharmacologic effect of single doses of SAM-531 on sleep EEG in healthy subjects.
explanation_target: Reason: The study description and title evaluate pharmacologic effects of single doses of SAM-531 on sleep EEG/qEEG in healthy subjects (a Phase I pharmacodynamic/safety study), which indicates a symptomatic/pharmacodynamic aim rather than disease modification. citeturn1search7

Act: SAM-531 is cerlapirdine (PF-05212365), a selective, potent 5‑HT6 receptor antagonist — a small-molecule class developed for symptomatic treatment to improve cognition in Alzheimer’s disease (i.e., a cognitive enhancer), not a biologic targeting amyloid/tau. citeturn0search7turn0search5

Reflect: Given the mechanism (5‑HT6 receptor antagonism) and the study focus on EEG/pharmacodynamics in healthy volunteers, the correct category is 'cognitive enhancer' (category 3). There is no indication in the description that SAM-531 is a biologic or a disease‑modifying agent. citeturn0search7turn1search7

Web search results used (summary): [PubMed — disposition/metabolism paper identifying cerlapirdine = SAM-531 and describing it as a 5‑HT6 antagonist]. citeturn0search7; [MedPath / ClinicalTrials entries — Phase I/II records for SAM-531 including the sleep EEG healthy-subject study (NCT00519298) and other safety/PK trials]. citeturn1search7turn0search4; [AdisInsight trial profile — trial listing for the sleep EEG study linking cerlapirdine (SAM-531) and donepezil]. citeturn1search1

Notes/ambiguity: Classification is clear because the compound is a small‑molecule 5‑HT6 antagonist (symptomatic cognitive target). If you want, I can fetch the original ClinicalTrials.gov record(s) (NCT IDs) or the 5‑HT6 antagonist literature for more detail. citeturn1search7turn0search7
explanation_agent: Reason: The trial is a Phase I pharmacodynamic/safety study that evaluates single doses of SAM-531 (cerlapirdine) on sleep EEG/qEEG in healthy volunteers, indicating a symptomatic/pharmacodynamic aim (not disease modification). citeturn1search0

Act: SAM-531 is cerlapirdine (PF-05212365), a selective, potent small-molecule antagonist of the 5‑HT6 (serotonin) receptor — a classical neurotransmitter receptor target pursued as a symptomatic cognitive enhancer in AD. citeturn0search2turn0search0

Reflect: 5‑HT6 is a neurotransmitter (serotonin) receptor; according to CADRO this maps to D) Neurotransmitter Receptors. The study and drug mechanism do not indicate amyloid/tau, inflammatory, or disease-modifying targets, so D is the most specific fit. citeturn0search5

Web search results used (key sources): (1) Clinical trial record for the sleep EEG study (NCT00519298) confirming design and PD/safety focus. citeturn1search0 (2) PubMed disposition/metabolism paper and descriptions identifying cerlapirdine = SAM-531 and describing it as a selective 5‑HT6 receptor antagonist. citeturn0search2 (3) Product/target summaries (MedChemExpress, MedKoo/TargetMol) describing cerlapirdine (SAM-531; PF-05212365) as a selective 5‑HT6 antagonist developed as a cognitive enhancer. citeturn0search0turn0search4turn0search5
